comments:
This is an ICU bug and I have fired it on ICU bug tracking system. But so far I haven't receive any reply. Wonder if anybody know how to escalate the priority. I enter this bug in DTP just for reminder. Below is the description I gave in ICU bug tracking system, which you can find at:http://bugs.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/others?id=5146


ICU Version: 3.4
OS: win32
JAVA: sunjdk1.4.x

My environment is:
Microsoft Windows 2000 5.00.2195 sp4 English, current code page: 936(ANSI/OEM
Simplified Chinese-GBK)
Eclipse 3.2M5
ICU4J 3.4.2
When I call TimeZone.getDefault(), a NullPointerException will be thrown. Here's
the error log:
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZone.getDefault(TimeZone.java:697)
	at com.ibm.icu.text.SimpleDateFormat.initialize(SimpleDateFormat.java:466)
	at com.ibm.icu.text.SimpleDateFormat.<init>(SimpleDateFormat.java:447)
	at com.ibm.icu.text.SimpleDateFormat.<init>(SimpleDateFormat.java:299)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.result.internal.Constants.<clinit>(Constants.java:28)
	... 5 more

Verified using ICU4J3.4.4.1 shipped with Eclipse 3.2 RC2, the problem has been
fixed.
http://bugs.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/returned?findid=5146
